intro: Aidia waugia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Aidia waugia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
